calendars.name: Timeline calendar
calendars.description: A timeline of all the known events

events.name: Summer Solstice
events.description: At the summer solstice, the Sun travels the longest path through the sky, and that day therefore has the most daylight.

events.name: Winter Solstice
events.description: The winter solstice marks the shortest day and longest night of the year, when the sun is at its lowest arc in the sky.

events.name: Spring Equinox
events.description: The equinox marks the day and the night is equally as long.

events.name: Autumn Equinox
events.description: The equinox marks the day and the night is equally as long.

events.name: Christmas
events.description: Christmas is a Christian holiday celebrating the birth of Christ. Due to a combination of marketability and long lasting traditions it is popular even among many non-Christians, especially in countries that have a strong Christian tradition.

events.name: Paschal Full Moon
events.description: The first full moon after march 21st, which is considered the fixed date for the spring equinox.

events.name: Easter
events.description: Easter is considered the most important feast for Christians, celebrating the resurrection of Christ. It is classed as a moveable feast occurring on the first full moon after the spring equinox, which is considered to be fixed at March 21st for the sake of computing the date.

events.name: Easter Monday
events.description: The Monday following the Easter Sunday is often considered part of the Easter Celebration and is a day off in many countries with a strong Christian tradition.

events.name: Good Friday
events.description: Good Friday is the Friday preceding Easter. It comemmorates the crucifixion of Christ according to the Bible.

events.name: Pentecost
events.description: Celebrated exactly 50 days after Easter, Pentecost is the celebration of the Holy Spirit appearing before the Apostles as described in the Bible.

events.name: New Year's Day
events.description: New Year's Day marks the date of a new year on the Gregorian Calendar. It dates when the clock strikes midnight and is often celebrated with fireworks, champagne and kissing.

events.name: Valentine's Day
events.description: Valentine's day is a celebration of love and romance that is popular across the world. Many more cynically minded people mostly consider it an attempt to monetize the expectation of romantic gestures on the holiday through gift cards, flowers, chocolate and dates.

events.name: Halloween
events.description: Halloween is holiday popular in the US, Canada and Ireland that has gradually been adopted by more and more countries. It is often celebrated by people dressing up, usually as something scary. Children will often go from door to door shouting "trick or treat" in the hopes of receiving candy, while adults tend to go to parties.

events.name: Henry Jennings is born
events.description: Henry Jennings is born as the youngest child out of 16 to Phillip Jennings of Duddleston Hall, Shropshire. He leaves England at the age of 20 with his mother after the death of his father and settles in Bahamas and then on Jamaica

events.name: Benjamin Hornigold is born
events.description: Benjamin Hornigold is born in England

events.name: Blackbeard is born
events.description:
Edward Teach Jr. is born to the family of captain Edward Teach in Bristol. The family (including his mother and sister) soon moves to Jamaica, where his mother dies on January 1699 and his father remarries in June of the same year. 
His father dies in 1706.

events.name: Charles Vane is born
events.description: Charles Vane is born in Jamaica

events.name: Calico Jack is born
events.description: John Rackham is born in England

events.name: Stede Bonnet is born
events.description: Stede Bonnet is born on Barbados into the family of a rich plantation owner

events.name: Mary Read is born
events.description: Mary Read is born as a bastard and the second child of a widow, who's husband got lost at sea. After her baby step-brother died, her mother started masquerading Mary as her dead brother

events.name: Sam Bellamy is born
events.description:
Sam Bellamy is born as the youngest of 6 children in Devon, England to a black family. His mother soon dies due to complication from giving birth.
His father is the local lord, who his mother served. He later kept the father's family name.

events.name: Élie Angevau se narodila
events.description: Élie is born into a family of wealthy nobility of French descent on St Martin as the only child. Her mother dies soon after her birth

events.name: Anne Bonney is born
events.description:
Anne Bonney is born in County Cork, Ireland as a illegitimate daughter of an attorney and his servant woman Mary. Her father started presenting Anne as legitimate, moved away from his wife and her family to London and started dressing Anne as a boy and bringing her up to be a layer's clerk.
After his wife discovered this, Anne's father moved together with her and her mother Mary to Charles Town in South Carolina, where he was eventually able to buy a townhouse and a plantation.
Anne's mother died when Anne was still young.

events.name: Israel Hands is born
events.description:
Izzy Hands is born to Katherine Hands, a prostitute in Bristol. His mother dies when he is 8 years old and Izzy decides to become a sailor.
According to his mother, his father is Edward Drummond, a sailor that used to visit her. Unbeknown to him or his father, Edward Drummond is a fake name that Blackbeard used in port when he was still in the navy

events.name: Elizabeth Teach is born
events.description: Elizabeth Teach is born to Blackbeard and an unknown mother in Port Royal. Soon after her birth she's given away to be taken care of by Blackbeard's step-mother and father in Kingston

events.name: Élie Angevau runs away from home
events.description: Shortly after her 18th birthday and the night before her wedding to admiral Jennings, Élie runs away from home

events.name: Josiah Burges takes Nassau
events.description: Josiah Burges takes over the small pirate town of Nassau and becomes the pirate governor

events.name: Hornigold and Jennings become pirates
events.description:
Ben Hornigold and Henry Jennings become pirates.
Edward Teach, Charles Vane and Sam Bellamy start their pirate careers in their crews

events.name: Aksim al-Jamil appears
events.description: Aksim disappear from his world and appers in this one

events.name: Anne and James Bonney marry
events.description: Anne marries James Bonney. Anne's father doesn't approve of his daughter marrying a poor sailor and disinherits her. The pair moves to Nassau.

events.name: Calico Jack meets Anne Bonney
events.description: Calico Jack meets Anne Bonney in a pub in Nassau and the two fall in love

events.name: Anne and James Bonney divorce
events.description: After several months or trying, Calico Jack finally manages to bribe James Bonney into officially divorcing Anne

events.name: John Cockram retires
events.description: John Cockram leaves the crew of Ben Hornigold where he was the 1st mate and founds a trading company that specializes primarily in supplying pirate ports

events.name: Blackbeard becomes 1st mate
events.description:
Hornigold promotes Teach to 1st mate and Teach gets his own ship.
Izzy Hands joins Teach's crew

events.name: Calico Jack meets Mary Read
events.description: Mary Read begins working in Calico Jack's crew dressed as a man, becomes close with Anne to whom she revelas her secret and eventually joins Jack's polycule

events.name: 1st Pirate Republic in Nassau
events.description: Jennings and Hornigold form the Pirate Republic and become co-governors, taking command of Nassau from Burgess

events.name: Charles Vane becomes captain
events.description: Charles Vane separates from Jennings and becomes captain

events.name: Calico Jack becomes 1st mate
events.description: Vane promotes Calico Jack to 1st mate and Jack gets his own ship.

events.name: Josiah Burges accepts pardon
events.description: Josiah Burgess accepts the king's pardon and settles in Jamaica

events.name: Black Bart Roberts becomes captain
events.description: Roberts is elected by his crew as their new captain after the former captain's death

events.name: Sam Bellamy meets Goody Hallett
events.description: While visiting relatives in Cape Cod, Massachusetts, Bellamy meets Goody Hallett, a local herbalist, and falls in love. But her parents don't want to let her marry a poor sailor, so Sam decides to rob a great treasure and then to come back a wealthy man to ask for Goody's hand in marriage again

events.name: Sam Bellamy becomes captain
events.description: Due to the crew's dissatisfaction with Hornigold's refusal to attack the ships of his native Britain, Bellamy separates from Hornigold and becomes captain

events.name: Paulsgrave Williams becomes 1st mate
events.description: Bellamy promotes his best friend Williams to 1st mate.

events.name: Brock Dewlap comes to Nassau
events.description: Brock moves from London to the Bahamas and settles in Nassau, where he opens a shop

events.name: Calico Jack and Anne Bonney marry
events.description: Calico Jack and Anne Bonney officially marry on the sea

events.name: Charles Vane accepts pardon
events.description: Charles Vane accepts the king's pardon and leaves piracy behind

events.name: Calico Jack becomes captain
events.description: In response to Charle Vane accepting the king's pardon, Calico Jack becomes captain

events.name: Stede Bonnet meets Blackbeard and Bonnet
events.description: Blackbeard and Hornigold find a wounded Bonnet, Blackbeard seizes Bonnet's ship, and Bonnet moves aboard Blackbeard's ship

events.name: Charles Vane returns to piracy
events.description: Charles Vane breaks the king's pardon and returns to piracy. This marks the beginning of his infamy of cruelty

events.name: Hornigold and Jennings publicly break up
events.description: No one knows exactly what happened between Jennings and Hornigold, but chaos broke out on the docks one evening when one of Jennings' ships caught fire and Captain Jennings was nearly burned to death. According to witnesses, Jennings and Hornigold had a loud argument before the fire, and people believe Hornigold set the boat on fire as he left. Since then, the two captains have practically not spoken to each other, and Hornigold turns red with rage at the mention of Jennings' name

events.name: Blackbeard becomes captain
events.description:
In response to Jennings and Hornigold's stormy split and Blackbeard's support of Jennings, Blackbeard splits from Hornigold and becomes captain.
Bonnet moves with him.

events.name: 2nd Republic of Pirates in Nassau
events.description: Blackbeard is elected the new governor of the Pirate Republic

events.name: Israel Hands becomes 1st mate
events.description: Blackbeard promotes Israel to the post of 1st mate

events.name: Jennings and Silvermouth start dating
events.description: Henry Jennings and John Silvermouth, Captain Hornigold's navigator, start dating and keep their relationship a secret due to the rivalry between Jennings and Hornigold

events.name: Raine and Calico Jack break up
events.description: Raine gives Calico Jack the boot and leaves his crew

events.name: Session 1
events.description:
This is where the first joint session of the campaign begins.
Raine and Aksim meet at the Thirsty Squid, where they recruit a crew and subsequently receive their first assignment from Blackbeard

events.name: Sam Bellamy dies
events.description:
Sam returns to Cape Cod to his sweetheart, fully prepared to give up piracy so they can finally get married and settle down together.
The Whydah Galley runs into a heavy storm off Cape Cod, causing the ship to run aground and Sam goes down with the ship. Only 2 survivors remain from the entire ship and 104 dead eventually wash ashore

events.name: Anne Bonney gives birth to a son
events.description: Anne Bonney moves in with family in Cuba, where she gives birth to her first child with Calico Jack. After a few weeks, she returns to the sea and leaves her son in the care of her father

events.name: The end of piracy in Port Royal
events.description: The British Army decided to take back control of Port Royal. The pirates they couldn't drive out, they executed, and Port Royal became the main pirate gallows

events.name: Hornigold accepts pardon
events.description: Hornigold accepts the king's pardon and becomes a pirate hunter

events.name: The end of the Pirate Republic in Nassau
events.description: Governor Woodes Rogers arrives in Nassau to drive out the pirates who did not accept the pardon. The Pirate Republic ends

events.name: Henry Jennings accepts pardon
events.description: Jennings accepts the king's pardon and uses his fortune to buy a plantation in the Bermuda Islands, where he settles with Silvermouth

events.name: Queen Anne's Revenge runs aground
events.description: Queen Anne's Revenge runs aground and is abandoned

events.name: Blackbeard and Bonnet accept pardon
events.description: Blackbeard and Bonnet receive the king's pardon in the city of Bath. But Blackbeard runs away before he could sign, leaving Bonnet to accept the pardon by himself. Bonnet frantically tries to find him but they never meet again

events.name: Stede Bonnet returns to piracy
events.description: Bonnet returns to piracy under the pseudonym "Captain Thomas Edwards" to get revenge on Blackbeard

events.name: Blackbeard accepts pardon again
events.description: Blackbeard moves to Bath and accepts the pardon after his first failed attempt to receive a pardon

events.name: Blackbeard returns to piracy
events.description: Blackbeard does not last long in Bath as an orderly citizen and returns to piracy

events.name: Ocracoke orgy
events.description: Blackbeard and Charles Vane meet on Ocracoke Island, where their crews rest, while they debate for a few days. Calico Jack also joins them

events.name: Stede Bonnet is arrested
events.description: Bonnet is arrested and imprisoned in Charles Town. He managed to escape from prison, but on November 10, 1718 he's caught again

events.name: Blackbeard dies
events.description: Blackbeard dies after a battle with Lt. Robert Maynard off Ocracoke Island, his body is then thrown into the bay and his head is hung from the bowsprit of Maynard's ship and then displayed at the entrance to Chesapeake Bay for several years

events.name: Stede Bonnet dies
events.description: Bonnet is convicted and hanged. His body is then buried in a swamp near Charleston

events.name: Benjamin Hornigold dies
events.description: Hornigold dies in a severe storm at sea somewhere between New Providence and Mexico. His ship sinks with him and only 5 men are saved

events.name: Calico Jack, Anne and Mary are arrested
events.description: Calico Jack, Anne and Mary are arrested and taken to Port Royal to stand trial for piracy

events.name: Calico Jack dies
events.description: Calico Jack is convicted of piracy and executed, his body is hung in a cage on a small island close to the entrance to Port Royal harbor as a warning to other pirates

events.name: Charles Vane is arrested
events.description: Charles Vane is arrested after trying to join another crew under a false name after being shipwrecked on a desert island but is exposed

events.name: Charles Vane dies
events.description: Charles Vane is executed and his body is hung in a cage on a small island near the entrance to Port Royal harbour as a warning to other pirates

events.name: Mary Read dies
events.description:
Mary Read dies in Port Royal prison from complications during her pregnancy. Her child dies with her.
Anne Bonney dissapears from prison a few days afterwards

events.name: Anne Bonney gives birth to a daughter
events.description: After escaping from prison, Anne Bonney moves in with her family in Cuba, where she gives birth to her second child with Calico Jack. She remains in Cuba with her children until her death

events.name: Black Bart Roberts dies
events.description:
Captain Roberts dies off Cape Lopez after his ship is discovered by a Navy ship and fails to escape.
Captain Roberts was killed by grapeshot, which struck him in the throat while he stood on the deck. Before his body could be captured by Ogle, Roberts's wish to be buried at sea with all his arms and ornaments on (a request he had repeated in life) was fulfilled by his crew, who weighed his body down and threw it overboard after wrapping it in his ship's sail. It was never found

events.name: Israel Hands dies (?)
events.description: Israel Hands dies on the streets of London as a beggar

events.name: "A General History of the Pyrates" comes out
Anne Bonney dies
events.description:
Anne Bonney dies 12 years after her prison break and is buried in the same cemetery next to Mary Read
https://www.postandcourier.com/news/a-22-year-old-youtuber-may-have-solved-anne-bonny-pirate-mystery-300-years-after/article_78fc0a2e-2914-11eb-a5f5-03b65f4d281a.html

events.name: Henry Jennings dies
events.description: Henry Jennings dies peacefully on his plantation in Bermuda

events.name: Session 1
events.description:
This is where the first joint session of the campaign begins.
Raine and Aksim meet at the Thirsty Squid, where they recruit a crew and subsequently receive their first assignment from Blackbeard

events.name: Isla de Nadie is revealed
events.note: The world/Locations/Isla de Nadie/Isla de Nadie.md

events.name: Isla de Nadie is revealed
events.note: The world/Locations/Isla de Nadie/Isla de Nadie.md

events.name: Charles Vane's ship is wrecked
events.description: Charles Vane's ship is wrecked off the coast of Isla de Nadie, leaving him as seemingly the only survivor. Haunted by the ghosts of his crewmembers, after a few weeks he accepts the king's pardon and retires

calendars.name: Timeline
calendars.description: Timeline of all the known events

events.description: Blackbeardova dcera Elizabeth Teach se narodila

events.name: Hornigold a Jennings se stávají piráty
Anney Bonney a Jack Bonney mají svatbu
Calico Jack se stává velícím důstojníkem
Paulsgrave Williams se stává velícím důstojníkem

Hornigold a Jennings se veřejně rozchází
